channel.title: miscellaneous on John Forstmeier
channel.description: Recent content in miscellaneous on John Forstmeier

item.title: Longevity Wish
item.description: I want longevity to manifest so that exploring the cosmos for a decade only feels like a year.

item.title: More Impressionism
item.description: Another wonderful example of impressionism [1] by Manet [2] is “Tarring a Boat” [3]. Personal highlights ship inner details are expressed but not defined interesting strokes for the anchor in the foreground no specifics are conveyed on people in the image

item.title: Stationary Radical
item.description: I’ve become a radical by sitting still while the world moved.

item.title: Right vs Reasonable
item.description: I can work with someone who isn’t right but I can’t work with someone who isn’t reasonable.

item.title: Amortal Death
item.description: The moment we become amortal, God will have to kill us. The only thing that can kill an amortal being is an immortal one. And if our lives can’t end naturally, only the end of the universe will bring us down.

item.title: Breathe
item.description: Take a deep breath. And then take another.

item.title: Friend Disagreements
item.description: Friends can disagree over things that matter.

item.title: Impressionism
item.description: Impressionism [1] as a painting style has a strong personal, albeit uninformed, appeal. The style prefers to see everything in a given scope without focusing on specific details. Produced images are more of a summary or a simplification of the subject which significantly reduces cognitive overhead in consuming these pieces. A favorite is The Battle of the Kearsarge and the Alabama [2] by Ã‰douard Manet, pictured below. Personal highlights: smoke obscuring ship details or entire vessels quick lines for distant masts and rigging approximately two-thirds is water most of which is empty no specifics are conveyed on people in the image

item.title: Born With Nothing
item.description: It’s worth reiterating that you are born with nothing and no one owes you anything. All you have are your rights and even those have been endowed to you. Remember you are dust and unto dust you shall return.

item.title: Conversation Percentages
item.description: So many people forget that fifty percent of every conversation between two people is silence. Active listening is a real thing; when I realize someone is really listening, the conversation has real meaning. I strive to provide the same attention.

item.title: First Sip
Where You're From
item.description: Where you’re from is only important if you’ve never left - otherwise, what matters is where you’re going. Maybe a tad cliche, but whatever.

item.title: Friends Favors
item.description: Friends don’t perform favors for friends, they just help their friends when they need it. Sort of a cheesy thing to say, but I believe it.

item.title: Family Blood
item.description: Family is more than blood. While I think blood is a decent, in most cases, default binding connection, I believe we can hold those that we choose to associate ourselves with in similarly high regard.
